# Industrial General Permit (IGP) Guide (2026)

## What is the IGP?

The Industrial General Permit regulates stormwater discharges from industrial facilities. Officially called the NPDES General Permit for Storm Water Discharges Associated with Industrial Activities.

## Who Needs Coverage?

Facilities with SIC codes in these categories:

### Category A - Timber/Wood
- Logging, sawmills, wood preservation
- SIC 24XX

### Category B - Paper
- Pulp mills, paper manufacturing
- SIC 26XX

### Category C - Chemicals
- Chemical manufacturing
- Petroleum refining
- SIC 28XX, 29XX

### Category D - Mineral/Asphalt
- Asphalt, concrete, glass
- SIC 29XX, 32XX

### Category E - Primary Metals
- Steel mills, foundries
- SIC 33XX, 34XX

### Category F - Transportation/Metal Fabrication
- Ship building, vehicle manufacturing
- SIC 35XX, 36XX, 37XX

### Category G - Landfills
- Active landfills
- Landfills with recent waste

### Category H - Scrap Recycling
- Auto salvage
- Scrap metal

### Category I - Transportation
- Airports, railroads
- Trucking terminals

### Category J - Wastewater Treatment
- Treatment plants with industrial pretreatment

## Enrollment Process

### Step 1: Develop SWPPP
- Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plan
- Facility-specific

### Step 2: Register in SMARTS
- [Annual Reporting Requirements](https://smarts.waterboards.ca.gov)
- Create account

### Step 3: Submit NOI
- Notice of Intent
- Upload SWPPP
- Pay annual fee

### Step 4: Receive WDID
- Coverage confirmed
- Begin compliance

## Annual Fees (2025-26)

| Industrial Acres | Annual Fee |
|------------------|------------|
| < 1 acre | $1,701 |
| 1 to < 5 acres | $1,723 |
| ≥ 5 acres | $1,873 |

## Monitoring Requirements

### Visual Observations
- Monthly during operating hours
- Before and after storm events
- Document in logs

### Sampling
- Minimum 4 storm events per year
- Two samples per event (first and last hour)
- Parameters based on industry

### NAL/NEL Parameters

**All Industries:**
- pH
- Total Suspended Solids (TSS)

**Industry-Specific:**
- Oil & grease (many categories)
- Metals (metal industries)
- Others per SIC code

## Numeric Action Levels (NALs)

| Parameter | Annual NAL | Instantaneous NAL |
|-----------|------------|-------------------|
| pH | 6.0-9.0 | 6.0-9.0 |
| TSS | 100 mg/L | 400 mg/L |
| O&G | 15 mg/L | 25 mg/L |

## Exceedance Response

### Level 1 Status (Baseline)
- Implement SWPPP
- Conduct monitoring
- Report results

### Level 2 Status (NAL Exceedance)
- Enhanced monitoring
- Action plan development
- Report to Water Board

### ERA (Exceedance Response Action)
- Required after multiple exceedances
- Technical report
- Additional BMPs
- Possible structural controls

## Annual Report

**Due:** July 1
**Submit:** SMARTS online
**Contents:**
- Monitoring data
- BMP evaluation
- Compliance status
- Training records

## No Exposure Certification

If all industrial activities/materials are under cover:
- May apply for No Exposure Certification
- Reduced requirements
- Annual recertification

## Resources

**SMARTS:** [Annual Reporting Requirements](https://smarts.waterboards.ca.gov)
**IGP Order:** [Industrial Stormwater Program](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/stormwater/industrial.html)
**CASQA:** [CASQA Resources](https://www.casqa.org)

## Take Action
1. Learn more at [Industrial](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/stormwater/industrial.html).
2. Access the [Industrial General Permit (IGP)](https://smarts.waterboards.ca.gov) to manage permits and reports.
3. Learn more at [Industrial General Permit (IGP)](https://www.casqa.org).
